channel.title: meetup on R-Ladies #LdnOnt
channel.description: Recent content in meetup on R-Ladies #LdnOnt

item.title: Lightning Talks
item.description: This year is flying by! We have 2 more meetups before our regular summer hiatus. For our upcoming March meetup (March 3, 2020, 6 pm, LPL Central) we‚Äôre going to do Lightning Talks. These are quick 5-minute presentations on whatever you like. Really - anything. All levels of R proficiency are welcome! All topics are welcome! You can present on something you know well, something you‚Äôre in the midst of learning, or something you‚Äôd like to do and are just getting started with.

item.title: Coming up in 2020!
item.description: 2019 and the 2010s are coming to a close! We hope you all enjoy the holiday season in whatever way you do, and we can‚Äôt way to see you in the new year. January 14th, 2020: Our fearless leader Thea Knowles is coming back to visit us and to share her rmarkdown and bookdown wisdom with us. This will also be the month that marks 3 awesome years of R-Ladies London, and we‚Äôre so thrilled to have her with us to celebrate our birthday üéÇ!

item.title: So long, farewell, and stay tuned!
item.description: via GIPHY Thus concludes this season of R-Ladies #LdnOnt! Thank you to Jaky for leading us through our last workshop together, and to all of you who came out to these things over the last two and a half years. Workshop materials are posted in the usual places (website, GitHub, Drive). Some news that I‚Äôve spoken about a bit in person but not in any official capacity yet: Sally and I are stepping down as organizers.

item.title: SPSS 2 R: Materials
item.description: See you next year, R-Ladies! And thus concludes our final R-Ladies #LdnOnt event of 2018! Thanks to Daryn for leading our last workshop of the season, Transitioning from SPSS to R, version 2.0. We were a smaller crowd this time (that‚Äôs the end of the academic term, for you), but I think these are a great set of resources to have. SPSS 2 R: Two for the price of one!

item.title: Upcoming workshop: Figuring out figures in R with ggplot
item.description: Quick deets! ‚ùì What is R-Ladies? A low-key get together for people interested in using and learning more about R, a powerful statistical software program. We meet about once a month to feature different topics and speakers. üïõ When: Thursday, October 25, 5:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. üìçWhere: London Public Library, Central Branch (251 Dundas, right downtown). We will be in the Creativity Lab on the 2nd floor.
